title: How do antibiotics help fight off strep throat? - Quora

response.answer_text: Antibiotics (like penicillin) all work to take out a bacterium by a variety of different warfare tactics. In the case of a STREPtococcus infection, a drug like penicillin works by interfering with the bacteria’s ability to synthesize their cell wall. As times moves on, their cell wall weakens as it can’t make the connections to stay firm. Eventually, the cell wall breaks causing the bacterium to essentially explode thereby killing it.
